meanings.definition: A person who makes a mistake or messes up.
meanings.sent1: The new employee was a real screwup in the office.
meanings.sent2: Don't worry, everyone makes a screwup now and then.
meanings.sent3: The screwup at the party spilled juice all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: Being a screwup in the kitchen, she managed to burn toast.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pointed out the screwup in the math homework.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I always seem to screwup when I try to fix things.
meanings.sent2: If you rush, you might screwup the entire project.
meanings.sent3: He managed to screwup the simplest task by overthinking it.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to bake a cake ended in a massive screwup.
meanings.sent5: Try not to screwup the presentation by speaking too fast.

meanings.sent1: The small screwup in the report caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: Making a screwup in the budget can have serious consequences.
meanings.sent3: The screwup in the recipe turned the cake green.
meanings.sent4: His decision to take a shortcut was a major screwup.
meanings.sent5: The screwup in the schedule led to chaos in the office.
